answers.answer: Hi, this could be associated with neuropathy, sciatica etc. Vascular insufficiency could be contributing factor. Do you have diabetes or hypertension? Do you have enlarged inguinal lymph nodes?Get urine examination done to rule out infection. Do consult doctor for evaluation.

I really appreciate you taking the time to answer me back :)The obvious is sciatica but can that cause the painful erection?I do take lisinopril for high blood pressure and was checked for diabetes last october and I did not have it then. My doctor checked the lymph nodes yesterday during a physical examination

Hi, painful erection could be due to peyronie’s disease due to growth of fibrous plaques. For more information visit http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peyronie's_diseaseOther causes are spinal cord lesion, sickle cell anemia, neurological disorders etc.

question: This problem started about a month ago. I am a 39yo male and have been having back problems off and on for 9 months. My left leg has always had pain since, so I decided to go see a Chiropractor to see if he or she could alleviate it. After my 5th session I noticed a tingling sensation in my penis and a pulling/retraction pain. I awoke the next morning with a painful erection and ever since it has been painful. Also when I stand or stretch my penis retracts into my body and when I lie down it relaxes. I had an MRI of my back and they said they found nothing remarkable. The doctor also did a physical exam and found nothing wrong. I am in a lot of pain and frustrated. Any help would be extremely appreciated.Thank You,ChrisI
title: Leg and Penis Pain
